question: Which one of the following commissions were appointed by the British Government to investigate the massacre in Jallianwala Bagh?
explanation: The Jallianwala Bagh massacre was followed by the establishment of a non-official inquiry committee by Congress. The British Government appointed the Hunter Commission to investigate the Jallianwala Bagh massacre. The British Government did not initiate such inquiry until Congress had set up such a committee.
